comments.body:
Is this package really only for `python >=3.5`? In the `setup.py` it seems to indicate python2 support:

https://github.com/atavory/ibex/blob/master/setup.py#L129

I believe that supporting py2 would require the use of selectors which would preclude the use of `noarch: python`. Since no one is clamouring for a py2 conda package I applied the YAGNI principle.

I'm happy for a maintainer to step up and fix the recipe to also support py2 and if a user actually pops up requesting it I can look into it myself then. In the meantime I think it's fine putting less strain on the CI system until demand for py2 support actually materialises.

I agree with you. 

If an user request a package for python 2 we will have to create a package for that. :)

Thanks to put this in conda-forge! I'm going to merge this.
